summary: Mobile-first romantic, playful single-page birthday website with a modern scrapbook aesthetic (pastel colors, elegant typography, floating hearts), featuring a hero teaser with countdown, polaroid-style photo journey with heartfelt text, music upload/toggle widget, interactive envelopes reveals, and a grand finale with confetti + Happy Birthday + date-night coupon (optionally password-protected video surprise and an 'Our Spots' pinned map).
architectural_notes: Ensure background audio only starts after an explicit user interaction (e.g., first tap) to comply with mobile browser autoplay restrictions.
Prioritize mobile-first interactions: swipe gestures for gallery, tap targets sized for thumbs, and lightweight animations for performance.
Design interactions mobile-first: avoid hover-only mechanics; use tap-to-open with optional hover enhancements for desktop.
Countdown timer should define timezone/target date clearly and update smoothly without heavy battery drain (e.g., 1s interval).
If implementing password protection client-side, treat it as a light gate (obfuscation) rather than secure authentication; avoid storing sensitive secrets.

existing_features.title: Convert the experience into a single-page layout with vertically stacked sections (Hero ‚Üí The Journey ‚Üí Music Toggle ‚Üí The Tease ‚Üí The Grand Finale) and smooth scrolling between sections, while keeping the existing romantic scrapbook theme, tap hearts, and confetti effects.

Implement the Hero section with: (1) headline text exactly: "Wait... did I forget something today?" (2) a countdown timer to a configurable target date/time (default can be set in code), and (3) a button labeled exactly: "Click for a hint." The hint button must reveal a playful hint message and/or scroll to the next section.

Build "The Journey" section as an alternating layout of long, heartfelt paragraphs and polaroid-style photo cards. Each polaroid card must allow the user to upload/replace an image from their device and optionally edit a caption/text block associated with that image.

Add ‚Äúcute & teasing‚Äù paragraph content patterns into The Journey text blocks, including at least one visible ‚ÄúFake Out‚Äù paragraph that starts with a complaint and pivots into affection, matching the user‚Äôs example style and keeping the overall tone romantic, playful, and teasing.

Replace/extend the existing music control with a stylish floating music player widget that supports selecting/uploading an audio file from the user‚Äôs device and toggling playback (play/pause and mute/unmute). Audio must begin only after a user gesture, loop when enabled, and gently fade in when starting.

Implement "The Tease" section with a grid/list of "Open Me" envelope cards that reveal inside jokes or reasons (text snippets) on interaction. On mobile, tap should open/close the envelope; on desktop, hover should preview/open with a clear animated affordance.

Implement the Grand Finale section at the bottom with a button labeled exactly: "Don't Click This" that triggers a full-screen confetti explosion and reveals: (1) a prominent "Happy Birthday" message and (2) a ‚Äúdigital coupon for a date night‚Äù style surprise card with customizable coupon text.

Add an optional password-protected surprise within/after the Grand Finale: show a password input that unlocks hidden content when the entered password matches a configurable value (e.g., birthday or anniversary). The unlocked content must support showing an embedded video message (via a user-provided video URL) or a placeholder panel if no URL is set.

Add an optional ‚ÄúOur Spots‚Äù section that shows a simple interactive ‚Äúpinned spots‚Äù visualization without using external map/GPS services: display a stylized card with a faux-map/illustrated background and clickable pins; each pin opens a small popover with a title and short note (e.g., ‚ÄúFirst date‚Äù). Pins and text must be configurable in code.

Ensure the overall UI consistently follows a ‚Äúmodern scrapbook‚Äù aesthetic: soft pastel palette (not default blue/purple), elegant typography, subtle paper/grain texture feel, polaroid frames, sticker-like accents, and subtle floating heart animations that do not obscure content.

Add the generated static images (see image requirements) under frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI as decorative scrapbook elements (background paper texture, tape/stickers, envelope illustration accents) without fetching them from the backend.
